verb.description: Focus one's attention or mental effort on a particular object or activity.
examples: she couldn't concentrate on the movie

verb.description: Gather (people or things) together in numbers or in a mass.
examples: wealth was concentrated in the hands of the governing elite

verb.description: Increase the strength or proportion of (a substance or solution) by removing or reducing the water or any other diluting agent or by selective accumulation of atoms or molecules.

noun.description: A substance made by removing water or other diluting agent; a concentrated form of something, especially food.

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense bring towards a center): Latinized form of concenter, or from French concentrer to concentrate. concentrate (sense 1 of the verb) dates from the early 20th century.
